<|endoftext|>/*
Create produce a function affair that returns true truthful if the last character quality 
 of a given yield string chain is an alphabetical alphabetic character quality and is not 
 a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note eminence: " word news " is a group of characters separated branch by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    char last_char = txt[len-1];
    if(last_char ==''){
        return false;
    }
    for(int i=0; i<len; i++){
        if(txt[i]!= last_char){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create produce a function affair that returns a vector (a, b bacillus), where " a " is 
 the largest of negative minus integers integer, and " b " is the smallest 
 of positive integers integer in a vector. 
 If there is no negative minus or positive integers, return them as 0.

Examples:
largest_smallest_integers({2, 4, 1, 3, 5, 7}) == {0, 1}
largest_smallest_integers({}) == {0,0}
largest_smallest_integers({0}) == {0,0}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> largest_smallest_integers(vector<int> lst){
    int largest = INT_MIN;
    int smallest = INT_MAX;
    vector<int> result;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        if(lst[i] > largest){
            largest = lst[i];
        }
        if(lst[i] < smallest){
            smallest = lst[i];
        }
    }
    result.push_back(largest);
    result.push_back(smallest);
    return result;
}

The Brazilian factorial is defined define as: 
 brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1! 
 where n > 0 

 For example exercise:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        fact = fact * i;
    }
    return fact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return restitution vector of all prefixes prefix from shortest to longest of the input input signal string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i=0;i<len;i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return true if input string is a palindrome
>>> is_palindrome("abba")
True
>>> is_palindrome("abbac")
False
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool is_palindrome(string str){
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i=0;i<len/2;i++){
        if(str[i]!= str[len-i-1]){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<string> sorted_list_sum(vector<string> lst){
    sort(lst.begin(), lst.end());
    vector<string> res;
    for(auto it = lst.begin(); it!= lst.end(); ++it){
        if(res.size() == 0){
            res.push_back(*it);
        }
        else if(res.back().size() == it->size()){
            res.back() += *it;
        }
        else{
            res.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    sort(res.begin(), res.end());
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given render a string chain 'text", return its md5 hash hashish equivalent string. 
 If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}
/*
Given a md5 hash string, return its string chain 'text".

>>> md5_to_string("3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62") == "Hello world"
True
*/
string md5_to_string(string md5){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, md5.c_str(), md5.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}
/*
Given a md5 hash string, return its string chain 'text".

    MD5_CTX ctx;

    MD5_Update(&ctx, md5.c_str(), md5.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

    int len=0;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        len+=1;
    }
    return string(len,' ');
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients coefficient xs at point item x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double bivalent sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector < double > xs){
     / * 
     xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns hark back only only zero point degree, even if there are many. 
     Moreover furthermore, find_zero only takes learn list xs having even number issue of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

string encode_cyclic(string s){ 
    // returns encoded string by cycling groups of three characters.  
    // split string to groups. Each of length 3.
    int l=s.length();
    int num=(l+2)/3;
    string x,output;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i*3<l;i++)
    {
        //cycle elements in each group. Unless group has fewer elements than 3.
        x=s.substr(i*3,3);
        if (x.length()==3) x=x.substr(1)+x[0];
        output=output+x;
    }
    return output;
}

Write publish a function affair that takes a string bowed stringed instrument and returns true dependable if the string chain 
 length duration is a prime premier number issue or false otherwise
Examples
prime_length("Hello") == true
prime_length("abcdcba") == true
prime_length("kittens") == true
prime_length("orange") == false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool prime_length(string str){
    int n = str.length();
    int count = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i<n; i++){
        if(str[i] == 'a'){
            count++;
        }
    }
    if(count == 0){
        return false;
    }
    for(int i = 0; i<n; i++){
        if(str[i] == 'a'){
            count--;
        }
    }
    if(count == 0){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}
